news/boom-vision/.title: Boom Vision
news/boom-vision/.body:
Boom is not only a festival, it is a state of mind. Inspired by the principles of Oneness, Peace, Creativity, Sustainability, Transcendence, Alternative Culture, Active Participation, Evolution and Love, it is a space where people from all over the world can converge to experience an alternative reality.

Boom is a festival dedicated to the Free Spirits from all over the world. It is the gathering of the global psychedelic tribe and of whoever feels the call to join in the celebrations!! Boom is a weeklong unpredictable and unforgettable adventure. It takes place, every two years, during the August Full Moon, on the shores of a magnificent lake in the sunny Portuguese inland and every one is invited!

PSYCHEDELIC FOR US MEANS TO THINK OUTSIDE THE BOX

Psychedelic means mind manifesting but has been associated as an atribute for music, arts in general and alternative ways of life. Our perspective on psychedelia is that every single individual is essentially free. Free to think, to act, to create, and to respect one another. It is awakening a holistic awareness that all beings share the same pulse of life, that we are part of an interconnected Universe. We do not believe in the psychedelic orthodoxy that advocates to be pigeonholed in one style of music, one lifestyle, or one philosophy. We also do not resonate with the narrative that psychedelic consciousness means intoxication. To be free is to be aware, is to challenge the limits, is to think outside the box and not to submit to the dominant culture.

BOOM IS A MODEL OF ENVIRONMENTAL AWARENESS

An environmentally conscious event is a way to offer a concrete example that it is possible to live on this Planet in respect of Mother Earth and of one another. This is possible through a deep understanding of the cycles of life and humanity’s place within these cycles. Permaculture is a brilliant example of how such an understanding can be turned into practice.

Boom’s pioneering Environmental Program applies the principles of Permaculture to every single aspect of the Festival production. Moreover, Boom widely promotes knowledge and practices of sustainability through lectures, workshops and… practical example!

100% compost toilets (still to this day the only large event in the world to reach this result!); 100% on-site water treatment facilities, off-the-grid energy solutions, bio-construction, permaculture gardens, vegetable oil for the generators… these are just a few of the ground breaking projects that have granted Boom the most prestigious international prizes in environmental efficiency.

For further details please visit the environmental program page.


BOOM BELIEVES IN A BORDERLESS WORLD

Since its beginning in 1997, Boom is the home of the global nomadic tribe. Since then, it has grown organically by word of mouth into an incredibly culturally diverse festival, attracting people from 151 nationalities (2014). Boom is the celebration of the Earth’s multicolored Oneness. EVERY ONE is invited and EVERY ONE is called to consciously co-create a positive reality of Love and Peace, for us and for the next generations. We Are One!


BOOM BELIEVES IN TRANSCENDENCE THROUGH MUSIC

At Boom music is sacred. The dancefloors are temples where to transcend ordinary states of perception and the limitations of our egos. Through dance and music, we can reconnect to our own individual divine essence, while in synch with the beating heart of the whole tribe. All in One!

Scattered across four stages, music at Boom is as diverse as it gets: electronic, acoustic, classic, any style is welcome and represented in a different area, live concerts, djs sets, solo artists, bands… Boom started as a psytrance festival and has developed into an inclusive gathering, unveiling the surprising diversity of quality underground soundscapes.

Psytrance culture remains one of the inspiring sources of Boom's vision and intention and Boom remains as a testimony of the evolutionary potentials of such a culture.

Check the pages for each of the areas for details on the different visions.


BOOM ACTIVATES TRANSFORMATION

Boom’s ultimate aim is to facilitate individual and collective transformation. The Boom experience has been conceived to activate the vital force directing every being towards the fulfillment of its highest potential. To reach this ambitious goal, Boom relies on the continuous exchange of radically innovative knowledge and practices by countless Boomers, musicians, artists, teachers, visionaries, healers, farmers, ecologists, wisdom keepers, researchers, scientists, activists.

Besides the music stages and the countless art installations scattered all over the site, the other areas where Boom channels transformation are the Liminal Village, the Being Fields (formerly known as Healing Area) and the Visionary Art Museum. Here our hearts, bodies and minds can receive a full download of information through workshops, presentations, rituals and meditations. Check the single areas’ pages for more details.


NO TO CORPORATE SPONSORS, CORPORATE LOGOS AND VIPs,  YES TO INDEPENDENCE, SOLIDARITY AND CREATIVITY!!!

Boom is an autonomous zone of cognitive liberty and therefore is and will always be free from corporate sponsorship and logos. Boom is funded by the financial support of the thousands of people that buy the tickets and come to the festival.

Boom does not believe in VIP areas and special treatments, since every Boomer is a VIP! Boom adheres to the principle of ’thinking outside the box’, for the co-creation of novel ways of viewing reality and acting for its evolutionary unfolding.

Together, we make magic happen!

news/boom-karuna-project/.title: Boom Karuna Project
news/boom-karuna-project/.body:
The Boom Karuna Project s the festival's Social responsability project that aims to support local social initiatives.

“Karuna” is compassion in sanskrit, it was our main intention for launching a charity project to support the people around the region of Boom.

The neoliberal politics that have assaulted Europe are against the dignity of human beings.

Because Portugal is going through various social problems, we launched the Boom Karuna Project, a charity initiative where part of the revenues of Boom support social projects in the region (one of the oldest, poorest and with the lowest birth rate in the country).

In 2014 we donated €11,000 to the following NGOs: Quercus - Wildlife Recovery Center Castelo Branco (Environment and Biodiversity), AERID Castelo Branco (Children with special needs) and Sementes do Interior in Idanha-a-Nova (Free school movement).

news/boom-theme/.title: Boom Theme: Shamanism
news/boom-theme/.body:
As the Planet Earth is being transformed by human action, there is an ancient practice that is being re-awakened everyday.

After Water in 2010, Alchemy in 2012 and The Feminine in 2014, the theme at Boom 2016 is Shamanism.

The term shaman has been used randomly around the world, as a healer, sorcerer or magician. There are thousands of ethnic groups that have shamans, we wanted to look at these ancestral practices and at the roots of our collective spiritual past, honoring a very broad and complex topic. Shamanic traditions are found in America, Asia, Africa, Oceania and Europe and all of them vary from each other and only some of them use sacred plants for altered and visionary states of consciousness.  

Shamanic practices are the oldest cartography of the invisible world that we know. They are archaic practices, pre-monotheism, where soul travels to the realms of supernatural beings. They have been contributing to the surfacing of many ideas about the cosmos, heaven and hell and were then appropriated by many religions.

In shamanism there is a strong ecological vision. Everything around us has life and identity. This mutual interdependency is an advanced ecological position, where everything has a spirit / essence / consciousness, a preface in the perspective of Earth as the largest living organism with numerous smaller organisms acting in interdependence.

In Boom we celebrate the psytrance culture, a neotribal emanation of the connection between mind, body and sound. The recurrence of the word trance, takes us to its origins, to shamanism. All over the planet, shamans induced by the state of trance stimulated by the drum beats, travel through the invisible worlds to deal with the everyday issues of their communities.

In Boom we are also celebrating the creative essence of the human being and shamanism has been suggested as the igniter of the art of cave paintings.

In the early years of the 20th century  prehistoric cave paintings were discovered in the south of France which led to speculation on the semi-human and semianimal figures that were considered to represent shamans. Lommel in the 1960s popularized this theory in his book Shamanism: The Beginnings of Art. Nowadays, shamanic culture is one of the greatest inspirations for the planetary movement of visionary and psychedelic art, which is one of primordial elements of the Boom Festival.

We also want to think about any appropriation that Western culture has made of Shamanism. Shamanistic practices have accompanied human history and recently science has proven the enormous therapeutic and spiritual potential of these practices. In spite of this, the world is witnessing a dissemination of these practices that is at risk of leading to an appropriation and decontextualization of these ancient, sacred rituals. 

Shamanic themes, practices and characters appear throughout the history, religion and the psychology of mankind. We have to preserve this ancestral knowledge that has survived several cultural mutations and stand firm preventing them from being contaminated by consumer culture that has become such a reality of being a human in the beginning of the 21st century...

At Boom, we are celebrating shamanism as a reverence to the cosmos and the wonderment of everything around us.

May all beings be happy! May Boom 2016 be a collective manifestation of pure love, honoring the Shamanic traditions of imemorial times...

news/who-makes-boom/.title: Who Makes Boom?
news/who-makes-boom/.body:
Every year a new series of rumors about Boom circulate on the internet and around the world.

So far the Boom production always chose to have a low profile, based on the belief that Boom is beyond faces and beyond single individuals. Nevertheless we wish to make some points more clear.

So here is a list of various surreal rumors and our version of the facts! :-)

"Boom is made by Free Masons"/ "Boom is owned by Illuminati".
You guys must have noticed the eye inside the pyramid in the 2012 imagery of the Dragon!! Good job! Be aware, we will send this and many more mysterious symbols for you to keep alert (but nobody is mason here!!)…

"The Boom was sold to a commercial organization".
No way!! Good Mood Productions is the organization behind Boom Festival since its very beginning! Good Mood is in fact responsible for bringing Goa Trance to Portugal back in the early 90s and for starting the Boom Festival in 1997 (at the time in partnership with Monogatari). Besides Boom Festival, Good Mood has organized other events in Portugal and abroad (Brazil, UK, Israel, Goa), coordinated permaculture courses, curated art initiatives, developed environmental projects for festivals and natural parks, published the Boom Book, produced movies, DVDs and CDs (including the first-ever psychedelic trance cd by Portuguese artists). Since its inception Good Mood has gone through many “seasons”, people and teams, members have come and gone, migrating to different projects or departing from this dimension, while new ones have arrived, to keep the vibe alive. Since nothing in the world is done by one, two or three persons alone, it has been the talent and vision of many team leaders, team members, artists, unknown people, and crews throughout the years that have been fundamental to the adaptation of the festival to an ever mutating world. Boom is the result of a team of friends from many countries, in a non hierachical and consensus based decision making culture.   

"Boom is owned by a rich Jewish/American company".
Here we are really sorry to disappoint you!! Contrary to what seems a common belief, Boom Festival team is a group of people from Portugal and around the world and does not generate high profits. Revenues are applied on the Boomland and its projects. One part of the revenues is given to charity through the social initiative Boom Karuna Project. Team members are from many countries, enjoy a simple (and fun) lifestyle, focused in keeping Boom alive and working on several other projects. Most of the team live an alternative lifestyle across the world. Edition after edition, the festival struggles for survival due to its core characteristics. It is a festival with a non-commercial approach, a big investment in the environmental program, it gets fully redesigned after every edition, it has a strong social orientation regarding long term workers, and it has to survive within the hard-core Portuguese tax system and this means that production costs are extremely high.

"Boom was bought by Burning Man.”
We love Burning Man a lot!!! And we are very happy that Boom is considered with Burning Man, one of the most transformational and revolutionary events in the whole world! But we are independent from one another.

"Boom owns a land where there is an ecovillage".
Ah!! This is a hot topic for many people who wish that the Boom was a “permanent event”! Though to this day Boom does not own the Boom Land. But the future is still open to infinite possibilities. There is a lease ending in September 2016, after that date Boom has to generate funds to buy the Herdade da Granja in Idanha-a-Nova (aka Boomland).

"Boom is made by Brazilians".
Yes, the Boom Team has many fantastic Brazilian members, but there are also other hard working amazing people from 61 different countries (data from 2014)! Collaborating to bring Boom to life that allows us to transcend our nationalities. First and foremost we are all Boomers!

"Boom is sponsored by a big advertising agency".
Well, that would be true if this big advertising agency was made by all the Boomers who go back home and spread the vibe all over the world! Boom is a No Corporate Logo area with no other sponsors except the thousands of Boomers who invest their money in buying the tickets and coming to the festival. They are indeed the most effective and dedicated advertising agency that ever existed!! Without the Boomers there would be no Boom and they are at our thoughts and hearts everyday.

"Next Boom will be in France".
Well, there is only one Boom that will always happen in Portugal, a psychedelic festival and gathering of free people, but we hope that there are many other Boom-inspired events sprouting all over the world! Probably other Booms will pop up with no association with the original Boom Festival, or even copying its name, we can't prevent words to be used on several domains by unknown citizens, but there is only one Boom Festival that started in 1997 in Portugal focused on the development of psychedelic arts, music, culture and sustainability. Spread the vibe, to France and beyond!!

With Love and Eternal Gratitude
Boom Team

environment/mission-awards/.title: Mission & Awards
environment/mission-awards/.body:
Festivals must provide tools for change. It is Boom's commitment to create a reality that relates positively with the environment and contributes to the education and knowledge of all.

Boom's Environmental Program has been designed to provide the opportunity for all to become active co-creators of evolution.

Over the course of its almost 20 years of life, Boom Festival has developed several pioneering projects in the following areas:

– Sustainable energy resources
– Sanitation (Compost Toilets)
– On site Water Treatment
– Reuse of materials for building and reduced consumption
– Regeneration of habitats and ecosystems
– Recycling and composting of waste
– Promotion of public transportation, cycling and car-sharing to reduce CO2 emissions
– Eco-Art
– Bio-Construction and bio-fuel
– Social sustainability: Integration of minorities and people with special needs; developing a credible alternative to the models of mainstream culture
– Education on the principles and practice of permaculture and other environmental designs.
– Hosting of presentations by leading opinion makers and project leaders in the area of environmental consciousness.
 
Boom's firm and pioneering commitment to be an environmentally conscious event has been recognized by several prestigious awards:

- Outstanding Greener Festival Award 2014, 2012, 2010 and 2008.
- European Festival Award 2010 – Green’n’Clean Festival of the Year.
- European Festival Award 2012 – Shortlisted as one of the three greenest festivals of the year.
- Green Inspiration Award 2012.
- Member of the United Nations Music & Environment Stakeholder Initiative.

Boom's Environmental Program is not sponsored. It is a fully independent strategy, financed by ticket sales and developed by the Boom Festival in partnership with Ecocentro IPEC (Brazil). Its success depends upon the contribution of countless eco-team volunteers and of all the Boomers who have fully integrated Boom's ethos in their lives.

Please take part in this environmental experience by taking care of your garbage, the land around you and all organic systems in place!

THANK YOU!

environment/water/.title: Water
environment/water/.body:
All water used before, during and after the Boom Festival is returned to nature, as clean as we received it.

Water is the driving force in nature. It does not resist, it flows. At Boomland we take it seriously to clean the water that we use before, during and after the Festival. It is returned to nature as clean as we received it.

All the water from restaurants, bars, showers and other facilities is recycled on site by a radically innovative biological treatment system. Boom's water treatment system is based on bio-remediation and evapo-transpiration. This means that all grey water (from showers and sinks) passes through a living filter before it is allowed to infiltrate back in the soil.

The grey water passes through a series of garden beds where it is allowed to evaporate while the roots of aquatic plants undertake the first cleaning of the water removing minerals and storing them in their leaves.

The remaining minerals are circulated with the help of enzymes that are added to the water, specially constructed to allow these biological cycles to develop.
After enough time has passed, a complete ecosystem develops in the water and around it. This is the natural state of water, providing habitat for many animals and plants and thus sustaining life.

The result is crystal clear water ready for re-use in irrigation. No further treatment is required and all environmental regulations are met. In fact the water is tested.
Boom's pioneering water treatment facility is proudly on display right at the entrance of the festival. Here you can see several bamboo species, grasses, floating water plants and wetland species working together to clean the water.  

You can actively support this process by being conscious of saving water and using only what is necessary.

In 2012 Boom was granted the prestigious "Green Inspiration Award" for this water system.

 


Free Drinking Water
All water fountains scattered across Boom Land offer free drinking water for your comfort. This water comes from the public grid, it is mandatory in Portugal events to be connected to the public water provider for health and safety reasons. Water quality is monitored before, during and after Boom.
We ask you to be conscious and not waste this precious resource!

Water at Showers
In 2014 we limited the hours of water availability in the showers to prevent excessive consumption. There will be more hours of water availability in 2016 in the showers during the daytime. Please DON’T waste water and NEVER wash yourself in the lake.

environment/composting-toilets/.title: Compost Toilets
environment/composting-toilets/.body:
Many moons ago, Boom introduced the first 20 compost toilets. In 2006 it seemed like a radical idea. Nowadays, with exclusively compost toilets at the festival, Boom has become a model and has risen the global awareness to the benefits of this technology.

After several years of tenacious research, merging Boom technologies and knowledge with Ecocentro IPEC, an evolutionary scientific approach with partnerships with universities, DIY and DIT enthusiasts, Humus Sapiens, CompostEra, the Joe Jenkins approach, microbiology, and the specific characteristics of human dynamics at festivals, Boom has developed a unique composting toilet system for festivals.

Boom's compost toilets relieve festival goers from the horrors of having to go into a plastic stinky dark chemical toilet!

And the output?
Soil and liquid fertiliser ready to be used to create the Boom gardens!

Insights About Compost Toilets
A "Normal" toilet is water-wasting. This technology, developed in the last two hundred years, flushes a 1/3 of the potable global water down the drain! Makes no sense when 780 million people are still without safe drinking water.

This waste water goes into a sewage pit and then it is pumped into waterways and the ocean, thus regularly polluting marine environments. Septic tanks are also heavily unreliable. Absorption trenches often become clogged, overflowing into the garden or into underground water streams that could end up in rivers.

And the difference with composting toilets - We make soil!

The ethics behind composting toilets is that the soils of the world are either worn out and left without any fertile potential, or they are poisoned. The restoration and maintenance of soil fertility has become a planetary emergency. By collecting human manure in a festival of over 30,000 people we can create precious compost that can be added to soil for fertility!

Models
There are various models for composting toilets ranging from simple sawdust pits to the deluxe models where you don’t actually smell or see the manure until it has converted to humus and is it ready for the garden.

How do they work:
• You deposit your manure or pee. The composting tank is previously prepared with a special "composting bed" (with nutrients such as carbon) that facilitate the composting process besides literally neutralising the odors.
• After your deposit you need to close the toilet lid. This keeps the heat IN and flies OUT!
Note: Unfortunately most female hygiene products and nappies are made of plastic and chemicals. They must not be thrown in the toilet as they take decades to decompose. Please don't throw cigarette butts or plastic material or any chemicals into the toilets either!

Are compost toilets at Boom safe?
Yes! The secret to a safe composting toilet are the two T's - time and temperature.
There are many pathogen-killing processes that occur in composting human manure on its way to becoming soil. At Boom we rely on time and temperature to kill these organisms.

According to the master of poop, Joseph Jenkins (check out his book “The Humanure Handbook”) time is a major factor since human pathogens outside the human body die within a few months . Yet some pathogens may take months to die, so at Boom we keep the "pile" in the composting tanks for at least six months.

High Temperature is the other method for killing these organisms. By keeping the "pile" at 50ºC for 3 days (which is not difficult in Idanha-a-Nova!!), human pathogens will likely die. A combination of time and temperature will kill all pathogens.

The resulting material is then analysed in a laboratory. If the results are positive, all is returned to the land to create gardens.

environment/energy/.title: Energy
environment/energy/.body:
Much of today's global environmental and political crisis depends on energy. At Boom, we work at reducing our consumption and finding solutions for cleaner and more sustainable energy sources.

The sheer amount of people at the festival translates into a very high energy consumption. Our checklist takes into consideration everything from generators, to lights, appliances, art performances, transport, construction and much much more...

For much of the modern world, energy means the burning of fossil fuels. But not for us! Boom has developed several sustainable energy projects.

2008: YOUR OIL IS MUSIC - WASTE VEGGIE OIL IN THE GENERATORS

• In 2008 Boom collected and re-used 45,000 litres of waste vegetable oil for the generators. This avoided the emission of  117,000 kg of CO2 into the atmosphere;

• The vehicles used (one truck, two vans) run on waste vegetable oil;

• Boom had two generators: one 100kVA and one 80 kVA generators that run on waste vegetable oil.

 

2010: BOOM LAB - GOING SOLAR

• Boom built 3 small mobile photovoltaic stations with six 80 Watt panels. They were used to power the offices of areas such as Main Production, Sacred Fire, Healing Area and Ambient Paradise, and generated 2.4 kWh per day.

• The 4th solar station produced at the Boom Lab had an output of 3.2 kWh of solar energy per day.

• Boom Lab also developed a bigger station that was placed near the Main Production and workshops. Following the tilt of the sun, 18 panels produced 8.6kWh of solar energy per day.

 

 

 

2012 and 2014: BOOM OFF-GRID

Boom Off-Grid was a project started in 2012. The project is ongoing and its aim is to increase Boom's energy efficiency and use solar as much as possible. It involves several sub-projects as shown in the table below.

environment/bio-construction/.title: Bio-Construction
environment/bio-construction/.body:
Many of the natural materials used for construction reflect Boom’s ethos for ecology. We try very hard to use as little as possible when it comes to manufactured materials. Instead, we have made greater use of straw bale, earth, roots, wood, bamboo, cane, adobe and stone.

Boom's mission is to provide a concrete example that a festival experience can be a glimpse into a sustainable present and future. Given that the construction and manufacturing industry are responsible for the emission of almost 6 billion metric tons of carbon dioxide globally (data from 2008 on statista.com), the Boom experience demonstrates the realistic solutions that are available using alternatives methods, such as bio-construction and conscious living.

Our bio-construction projects minimise the use of products that require a considerable amount of embodied energy for their manufacture or transportation. We are also inspired by ancestral building techniques infused with a contemporary technological perspective for fruition at Boom.

Most of Boom is built from scratch, with designers challenged by the equation: 1 natural building = 1 piece of art.

We seek to harmoniously connect technologies with functional, artistic and decorative concepts in a natural environment that we simultaneously aim to protect; thus, satisfying our physical and spiritual needs.

environment/reuse-recycle-compost/.title: Reuse Recycle Compost
environment/reuse-recycle-compost/.body:
Reuse, recycle, compost: At Boom, we take this mantra very seriously!

COMPOST: We Make Soil!

Your body is a soil making machine! It takes Mother Nature up to 500 years to make 2 cm of soil and humans 2 minutes to destroy it through unsustainable practices. Yet by simply composting your food scraps and using dry toilets you are making soil.

In 2012 and 2014 we collected all the organic waste from the restaurants. This included the bio disposable bamboo plates and cups which amounted to 44 tons of organic waste collected in 2014. It is expected that ⅕ of this amount will be turned into compost to make soil for agriculture at the Boomland.

This soil is given back to the Earth in the form of gardens creating organic food for you to collect in 2016. You can turn your food scraps into soil by simply throwing them in the right bin. And let us do the rest!

RECYCLING

Recycling is one of our greatest challenges. The separation and recycling of garbage was completed outside of Boomland at a recycling unit. It was collected by the Ecoteam during the festival, placed in containers across the site, then removed and later separated in a public recycling unit called Valnor.  

Throw your recyclables in the designated bins, making sure that more stuff will be recycled into other things!

Please check the table below for a better comprehension of our evolution.

REUSE

Did you notice those glowing jelly fishes that served as lights along the nocturnal footpaths of Boom 2014? Did you know they were made from old plastic water bottles? It's just one small example for upcycling at Boom: We created something of higher value from what otherwise would have been just rubbish. Over the years, we embraced this principle more and more - as you can see on the info graphic below.

environment/gardens-and-regeneration/.title: Gardens & Regeneration
environment/gardens-and-regeneration/.body:
Three months before Boom an international team of expert permaculture gardeners and volunteers initiate the cultivation of the many gardens all over the Boom Land.

The botanist Luther Burbank once said, "Flowers always make people better. Flowers are sunshine, food and medicine to the soul". And at Boom Land we agree. Not only do they scatter colour across the dry summer boomscape, you can eat many of them too.

Three months before Boom an international team of permaculture gardeners and volunteers plant seeds all over the Boom Land. Luscious mandala gardens, water gardens, artistic spiral gardens are created offering the possibility to witness the marvels of nature and its breath-taking beauty.

During Boom, the gardens are special places to reconnect with nature's grand design. You will find basil, sage, rosemary and many other herbs scattered amongst the pumpkins, tomatoes and of course flowers.  Eat the organic delights remembering to tread lightly between the living creatures, insects and plants alike.

The Great Mother has orchestrated every little detail to create a perfect system for us to live in!

environment/public-transport/.title: Public Transport
environment/public-transport/.body:
It's eco-friendly. It's safe. It's convenient. The Boom bus is a win-win situation on wheels.

What's even better than eco-friendly travelling? Eco-friendly travelling that is convenient and fun! The basic idea of the Boom Bus was to save the environment by providing public transport to the festival. However, there's some more advantages: It's very convenient because you arrive directly in Boomland, and depart directly from Boomland. It's social, because you meet fellow Boomers already on the way to the festival. Last but not least, compared to other means of transport, you save money.

There are Boom Buses operating from Lisbon and Madrid airports as well as direct connections from France, Switzerland and Belgium.

environment/liftshare/.title: Liftshare
environment/liftshare/.body:
Want to come to Boom saving energy, reducing queues, lowering costs and meeting new friends? Join the Boom's evolutionary Liftshare initiative!

The way to Boom can be long, but it doesn't mean that it can't be fun! In order to facilitate the possibility for Boomers to join others and share the costs, decrease the CO2-emission, but also the fun of driving to the Festival, we have created a simple and effective way to share information about lifts (given and requested).

This way everyone can actively contribute to Boom's evironmental program, reduce CO2 emissions, reduce queues at the gates and have more fun!

If you would like to share a lift, please click here:

https://liftshare.com/uk/lifts/boomfestival

Other carpooling sites include:

www.freewheelers.co.uk | www.carpooling.com

program/dance-temple/.title: Dance Temple
program/dance-temple/.body:
Art, performance, sacred geometry, philosophical and spiritual input and music – there's a place where the manifold aspects of Boom's psychedelic vision become one: The Dance Temple.

Designed as a synergetic reactor, it provides the ultimate visual and acoustic stimulation for visionary experiences. In tune with the cycles of the Sacred Earth it creates a field of cosmic energy and universal love so powerful that it has an almost physical presence.

To set off spiritual transcendence, the Dance Temple uses one of the most powerful catalyzers known to humankind today: Psytrance music, and to really tap the full potential of this mind-expanding sound, it is synchronized with the rhythm of the day.

Every day starts with a concert of an Organic Trance band to revive the ancestral memory of the traditional trance with contemporary production. The moonlit mystery of the night is a perfect enhancement for deeply hypnotic genres like Dark, Forest or emanations of the best psychedelic music. The warmth of the sun is the right form of energy to multiply the ecstatic properties of Psytrance and Full-On, or classic Goa Trance and its Nu School adaptation. The golden bliss of the afternoon provides an intense feeling of euphoria for inspiring groovy Full-On and Progressive Psytrance grooves.

Similar to a shaman, the people on stage is as important as the Boomers in the dance floor, together they achieve a collective sacred state of Trance. However, that does not justify a cult of personality, Boom is all about the collective experience and the Dance Temple is the perfect place to indulge in great music, not in big names. The Boom experience is not about a line up.

As we want to experience Oneness, we kindly ask you not to bring any national flags and to avoid reminiscences of mainstream culture such as selfies or other self-centered emanations.

program/art/.title: Art Installations
program/art/.body:
There's a strong connection between visual perception and visionary experience. A picture is worth a thousand words and art is at the very heart of the Boom experience!

As a visionary festival, Boom puts great emphasis on its visual manisfestation. The entire festival is designed like a carefully arranged painting.

Land art, gardening, sculptures and paintings, projections, video mappings and all sorts of analogue and digital decorations create a scenery that re-ignites our sense of wonder and fascination. However, the visual setting of Boom is more than a highly aesthetic experience. Most of the art installations have educational aspects, as well, and inspire self-reflection and alternative views on life. In this way, visual perception and visionary experience really do become one.

A novelty in 2016 is the Garden of Interactive Tech Art. As the name implies, this new project is a playful balancing act between technology and nature. Boomers are invited to become an active part of this balancing act, and to establish a joyful synergy between these two worlds.

program/sacred-fire/.title: Sacred Fire
program/sacred-fire/.body:
Electronic music proved itself to be an excellent medium to reach higher states of consciousness. However, there's more to psychedelic sound than synthesized rhythms and melodies...

...and that's exactly what the Sacred Fire is all about: Immerse yourself in the harmonic ramifications of a sitar concert, engage in a trance dance ritual during a traditional African drum session, or face the mighty wall of sound that is built by a Psych Rock band. Though the Sacred Fire is much more than music, it is living in a forest fairy tale...

Surrounded by colorful flowerbeds and veggie patches, by cosy little nooks and crannies to hang out in, by carefully crafted fountains and sculptures, by organic food stalls and an arts & crafts market, by lanterns and swings hanging from the trees, the Sacred Fire has a very special atmosphere.

There's plenty of workshops and conscious food corners. The Sacred Fire is a place to learn and put your hands in earth with several permaculture and environmental practical workshops.

The grounded, earthy vibe of this place is a perfect match for the chiefly hand-made music that is played on stage. Each night has a special theme, such as Afro Beat, Psych Rock, Dub, Organic Trance, Brazil or Fusion Sound. There shall be no headliners and no supporting acts; There shall be a warm and organic flow of beautiful music.

program/liminal-village/.title: Liminal Village
program/liminal-village/.body:
This is Boom’s cultural space and wisdom lab, where radical ideas and the latest scientific knowledge converge in an entertaining and educational program.

In 2014 there was 120 hours of lectures, 10 discussion panels, 20 documentaries, 4 animation films, 6 movement workshops and a Symposium of Free Culture Spaces. The Liminal provides knowledge inspiration beyond the trance dance ritual of the music areas, a place for becoming aware of the new paradigms that pop up around the world and that are fueling the transition.

If the Dance Temple is the place nurturing mystical states of awareness - which require new answers to fundamental questions: Who are we? What are we doing here? Where are we going? - then the Liminal Village is the place where one finds the information needed to start building a new individual and collective identity through a new worldview. This is the place to acquire tools to build a more contemporary reality, able to match the fast evolving reality in which we are living with practical solutions for universal issues.

The Liminal Village presents lectures, workshops and discussion panels on environmentalism, natural living solutions, visionary artivism, integral nutrition, conscious dancing, ancient rites and mythology, therapeutical use of entheogens and medicine plants, hacktivism and social media, evolutionary life styles, political action for change…

The Liminal program is rounded out by Paradigms Films, a nightly showcase of the latest documentaries and art films.

For 2016, Liminal presentations and workshops will once again be focused on themes close to the heart and vision of Boom and all Boomers...

program/chill-out-gardens/.title: Chill Out Gardens
program/chill-out-gardens/.body:
Inspired by the dialectics between Gardens, art and architecture, and last but not least by modern psychedelic culture, this place provides the perfect setting for physical and mental relaxation.

If we look at our collective history, some of the most brilliant works of architecture were a dialogue between art and gardens. The Hanging Gardens of Babylon, the Epicurus Gardens, the Taj Mahal or the imperial gardens of Kyoto are just a few examples. Honoring the magnificent nature of Boomland, the Chill Out is a dialogue between music, nature, temporary architecture or workshops (do you remember the trash art workshops in the Chill Out Gardens in 2014?). You can hang out in beautiful gardens, have a massage in the Being Hub or be astonished by an art installation. In 2016 the Chill Out Gardens area is a concept project developed by Bamboo DNA.

This is where the rolling lakeside beauty of Boom Land extends into a dimension beyond spatial extension. It's a mesmerizing soundscape with wafts of harmony rising from a heaving sea of bass frequency, with crystal crusted mountain peaks lurking over the melodic thicket of a mysterious sound jungle. 

Music-wise, the Chill Out Gardens are not built around particularly bright flowers - they are an organic arrangement full of precious colours and sublime beauty. It's a place that has a very special vibe as a whole, not only during particular performances. Fueled by Chill Out music in all its forms, Ambient, Electronica and Downbeat grooves it's a launching pad for journeys to Inner Space, it's the perfect place for inspired hangouts with old and new friends, and every now and then it even turns into an easy-going dancefloor.

This magic place between worlds is known as the Chill Out Gardens. And don't forget: being at Boom is a multi-sensory activation, it is not about a music line up!

program/alchemy-circle/.title: Alchemy Circle
program/alchemy-circle/.body:
Alchemy: The magical process of creating precious new elements through combination. What happens when you apply this ancient principle to modern psychedelic music? Find out in the Alchemy Circle!

Some refer to this area as “Boom's Alternative Stage” - but that's not right. Boom as a whole is an alternative, there is only one main focus: Psychedelic culture. The Alchemy Circle is dedicated to all aspects of this culture that have to do with the transmutation of contemporary rhythm and sound into new music genres. It is an update of previous music areas at Boom such as the Journeys Area (2000 and 2002) and the Groovy Beach (2008 and 2010). It's all about unexpectedness, surprise and danceability – with a deep and psychedelic twist. It is not an Alternative Area!!

You might find yourself moving and grooving to Dark Progressive, Neo Trance, Psy Breaks and Psy Techno, Glitch Hop, Psy Bass, Dub, or Progressive Techno... or some kind of hypnotic sound that doesn't even have a name yet. When the Alchemy Circle first woke to life in 2012 it was inspired by the fact that psychedelic music has always had a very rich and diverse background, and that it has never been restricted to one particular style. From Funk to Acid, from Jazz to Krautrock, from Cosmic Disco to PsyTrance – There has always been transmutation. In other words: There has always been alchemy.

The initial elements are extremely important for any alchemical reaction – but ultimately they are just means to an end. The most important aspect is the result, the precious new element that is created. That's why the Alchemy Circle is not about single artists. Boom is not about a line up. It's all about the careful combination of the creative energies to create a brilliant, coherent journey into sound.

As we want to experience Oneness, we kindly ask you not to bring any national flags, and to avoid reminiscences of mainstream culture such as selfies or other self-centered emanations.

program/healing-area/.title: Being Fields (former Healing Area)
program/healing-area/.body:
Statements like "It's a sick society!“ have become all too common. A clear symptom that human beings are loosing touch with nature, with each other, and even with ourselves. The Being Fields at Boom hold the invitation for reconnection to oneself, to others and to Mother Nature. To be in balance and harmony within will ripple to manifest balance and harmony on the outside. Here the invitation is for the journey in.

The Being Fields, formerly know as the Healing area, offer a great variety of physical and spiritual practices, of education and inspiration that invite you to reconnect essentially with yourself. It has for a long time become an essential part of the festival.

Yoga. Meditation. Oriental practices. Alternative medicine. Sweat lodge rituals. Water therapy. Transformational processes. Healthy Eating or simply just enjoying the magical beauty of the natural setting. Whether you are already engaged in these kinds of practices and they are a part of your life or if you have been wondering how you could benefit from them, the Being Fields provide a generous and diverse source of inspiration and new experiences that will support you in journey into yourself. For 20 hours every day, this is the place to regain harmony of body, mind and spirit which are the foundations for a healthy human being and thus a healthy society in tune with Mother Nature.

Many years ago, the Healing Area, now renamed Being Fields,  started as a special interest program beyond the dancefloor. Today, it is a major part of the festival. It reflects how more and more people become aware of the urgent need to reconnect with themselves, others and the planet.
The connectedness and consciousness field that has been arising at the Healing Area and that will again be generated at the Being Fields in 2016 reveals how Boomers are taking a concious, active step towards the collective evolution of human consciousness. Nurture your mind, your soul and your body for a better self and a better world!

program/performers/.title: Performers
program/performers/.body:
Boomland is an open stage! Performers from around the world meet during the full moon to honor the body as an art form!

A herd of dinosaurs stomps across the dance floor. Beautifully strange creatures glisten in the darkness, as if the biofluorescent fish of the deep sea decided to join the party. And right in the middle of the food court, there's some serious defiance against the laws of gravity going on.

These are the magic moments when an alien dimension blends into the reality of Boom Festival... a dimension known as the world of performance art.

Post-apocalyptic circus troupes, urban street artists, jugglers and fire artists with mind-boggling skills, and extraterrestrial clowns mingle with the Boomers. This cosmic carnival inspires us to return to that innocent and blissful state of mind we had as a child when the circus came to town.

program/museum-of-visionary-art/.title: Museum of Visionary Art
program/museum-of-visionary-art/.body:
The technicolored movement: A short glance at psychedelic culture is enough to notice that it has a very strong visual expression. From ancient times to the digital age, from shamans to hippies – whenever human beings pushed open the doors of perception, it inspired them to manifest their visual experience in an unique art form. The Museum of Visionary Art is dedicated exclusively to this art form, in all its contemporary splendour.

Putting the idea of an art gallery in the context of an open air festival might seem a little adventurous – but then again Boom as a whole is adventurous, isn't it? That's what happened in 2006 when Boom launched its first visionary art gallery. 
Fast forward to 2016! The Museum of Visionary Art is actually quite a logical step in the evolution of the festival. There's a long tradition of live paintings, workshops and exhibitions. The visual appearance of Boom has been shaped by countless visual artists, and at the same time many of these artists have been inspired by the Boom experience.

The Museum of Visionary Art is a place to showcase this dynamic process in a way that is just as sophisticated and beautiful as the art itself.

Visiting this cosmic gallery is like a journey through the history of psychedelic and visionary art, its influences and techniques. It's a mesmerizing collection of Amazonian and indigenous Medicine Art, Tibetan Buddhist Tradition, Electro Mineralism, Flemish Technique and Visionary Activist Art alongside with modern styles like Digital Fusionism, Sacred Geometry, Visionary Psytrance Deco Art, Visionary Graffiti Art.

program/nataraj-dance-stage/.title: Nataraj Dance
program/nataraj-dance-stage/.body:
A new area at Boom dedicated to one of the most ancient practices of gaining higher states of consciousness: Dance.

From Ecstatic Dance to Healing Dance, from the teachings of the 5rhythms to Trance Dance – the program of the Nataraj Dance Stage offers a wide and diverse range of inspiration.

Watch traditional ethnic dances and contemporary performances, or learn systematically how to take advantage of the dynamic movement of your body, both physically and spiritually.

However, it's not just another stage. Rather, it cultivates the rhythmic relation between body, mind, and music through a mixture of workshops and shows. Be part of this new, exciting adventure at Boom, submit your project on the "Participate" menu.

program/boom-landing/.title: Boom Landing
program/boom-landing/.body:
A small open air that channels the vibe of Boom into a takeaway message, into something that prepares and inspires you for your return to everyday life.

An afterparty wouldn't be the right thing for Boom. Why? Because the term 'party' implies something that is basically just another dose of dancefloor action. Of course that's one important aspect of Boom – but there's so much more. That's the idea behind the Utopia Boom Landing.

This gathering is similar to Boom, yet different. To create an intimate family vibe, it's much smaller. To re-calibrate the biological rhythm of the human body, the party takes place only during the daylight hours. To make the integration of new experiences and ideas into everyday life easier, the music program is complemented by extensive spiritual and intellectual practice, talks, healing rituals, meditations, therapies and other activities that support the process of transformation and integration of the Boom experience. 

A nice mix of electronic and acoustic music on 2 floors, a great variety of workshops and lectures... The future of this planet is in our hands, so let's get ready for an utopia come true!

boomguide/location/.title: How To Get To Boomland
boomguide/location/.body:
The Boom Festival takes place near Idanha-a-Nova, Portugal, on the shores of an enchanting lake, few kms away from the Spanish border. The closest main city is Castelo Branco. Boom is about 260 km from Lisbon and 360 km from Madrid (Spain).

 

BOOM FESTIVAL GPS COORDINATES

For reference look for Alcafozes, Idanha-a-Nova, Portugal.

BOOM BUS

Is there a charter transport to Boom?
Of course!!! It is the Boom Bus!!! The Boom Bus is a charter bus service for a safer, more comfortable and sustainable Boom experience, providing transport from Lisbon and Madrid airports directly to the festival and back. There are also connections from France, Switzerland and Belgium offered by one of our official partner.

The Boom Bus arrives at the festival venue one day before the official gates open. This means you can choose the best spot to camp, decompress from your journey and have some time to absorb the enigma of the Portuguese countryside merged with the futuristic Boom's structures, reminding you that the magic has already started…

More info HERE

 

PUBLIC TRANSPORT

How can I get to Boom from Lisboa airport?

By train: Take the Metro to Gare do Oriente station, from there you can get the train to Castelo Branco. 

By Bus: From the airport take the metro to Sete Rios bus station and from there take a bus to Castelo Branco. 

Please refer to the bus station website (www.rede-expressos.pt) and train station website (www.cp.pt) for departure times, costs and further information.

Local Bus from Castelo Branco directly to the Festival Gates: From the Castelo Branco train and bus station (same), there will be a paying local bus service directly to Boom Festival gates every day of the festival. On the 11th and 12th of August the local bus will be running continuously and in sync with arrivals of buses and trains from Lisbon. The remaining days of the festival, there will be one service a day, departing Castelo Branco. Timetable and service fee price will be available in December.
If you don't manage to get the local direct bus to the festival gates, find a bus to Idanha-a-Nova or share a taxi to the festival. 

Departure times for local buses from Castelo Branco to Idanha-a-Nova:
Monday to Friday:     07:30; 12:25; 17:15
Saturday:                  12:25 
Sunday:                    11:40

Idanha-a-Nova is around 20km from Boom Festival.

In Idanha-a-Nova there will be a paying local bus connecting directly to the Festival gates. This local bus will operate from the 11th to the 18th of August. Timetable and service fee price will be available in December.

 


How do I get to Boom from Madrid airport on public transports?

By Bus:
From Madrid you have a bus service that connects you to Lisbon. The Madrid Bus station (ESTACION SUR) is at Av. Méndez Álvaro and you find it at the Méndez Álvaro Metro station.

One of the companies that run buses to Lisbon is Avanza Bus. www.avanzabus.com

By train:
Make your way to CHAMARTÍN train station where there is one daily night train to Lisbon, departing at 21:50. This is a two step journey and you will have to change trains at ENTRONCAMENTO (PORTUGAL) and then continue on another train to CASTELO BRANCO. 
Please refer to the Madrid train station timetable (www.renfe.com) and the Entroncamento station timetable (www.cp.pt) for departure times, costs and further information.

 


BY CAR

How can I get to Boom driving from Lisboa?
Take the A1 motorway direction North, exit to A23, direction Torres Novas. Continue direction Castelo Branco along the A23, exit at Lardosa / Idanha-a-Nova. Follow the signs to Idanha-a-Nova. In Idanha-a-Nova you will reach a roundabout, you will find the signs to the Pre-Park and to Boom Festival.

If I come from Oporto, how can I get to Boom?
Take the A1 motorway, direction Lisbon until you reach signs for the A25, direction Viseu. Drive along the A23, direction Covilhã and Castelo Branco. Exit at Lardosa / Idanha-a-Nova. Follow the signs to Idanha-a-Nova. In Idanha-a-Nova you will reach a roundabout, you will find the signs to Boom Festival.

How can I get to Boom from Madrid?
Take the A5 motorway, direction Plasencia and Portugal. Take the A1, direction Plascencia and follow the signs for the Ex-108 to Coria/Portugal. Continue following signs to Portugal. As you enter the country you will see signs to Idanha-a-Nova. In Idanha-a-Nova you will reach a roundabout, you will find the signs to Boom Festival.


LIFTSHARE

I want to share my Boom experiece with other people, is there a car pooling?
We’ve created a simple and effective way for connecting people heading to Boom. If you would like to share a lift, then please find details right here:
https://liftshare.com/uk/lifts/boomfestival

boomguide/a-nice-boom/.title: A Nice Boom & FAQ
boomguide/a-nice-boom/.body:
Here you can read several useful infos about the Boom experiences. For other questions, there is a general FAQ page that you can read.

Welcome to Boom, where art, music, new and old friends, hot weather, dust, random encounters, discovering cosmic awareness, loosing your tent, changing your name, falling in love with a Portuguese, deciding to go to India or not to go to India anymore… can all contribute to an awesome yet unpredictable adventure!

We compiled a guide for your Boom immersion, "The Art of Living at Boom". It covers the most common scenarios and aims to help you make the most of your Boom.
 

THE ART OF LIVING AT BOOM (A SURVIVAL GUIDE FOR BOOMERS):

DOWNLOAD HERE (HI RES)

DOWNLOAD HERE (LOW RES)

 

FAQ

GETTING THERE

TICKETS

THE BOOM EXPERIENCE

PROGRAM
 

GETTING THERE

Boom is located in Idanha-a-Nova, Portugal.

If you want to know how to arrive to Boom Festival go HERE.
 


TICKETS

Tickets can be bought digitally on the Boom website and from the Boom Ambassadors spread all over the world. As usual the Boom ticket prices are decided taking social awareness into consideration: Flexible prices to suit the different economic realities of each country.

What kind of tickets can i get? How much do they cost? Are there different kinds of tickets?
All info related with Boom tickets click HERE

Do children need a ticket?
Children under 13 do not need a ticket, but they must be accompanied by parents or legal tutors. Young adults under 18 years old also need to be accompanied by parents or legal tutors. Note: Considering the high temperatures, loud noise and high levels of dust, we recommend parents not to bring children under 3 years of age!

If I have a ticket problem, who do I contact?
etickets@boomfestival.org.

 

 

BOOM AMBASSADORS

A Boom Festival Ambassador is someone or an organization that represents Boom. They can give you all the information you may need about the festival and also sell Boom tickets. They are the liason between Boom HQ and the Boomers, helpful brothers and sisters that do an amazing job.  They can also help you to sort out any question you might have. If you don't have a Boom Ambassador in your country, please contact the ambassador in the closest country to yours and he/she will sort out anything you may need. Or contact us by email: ambassadors@boomfestival.org.

Boom Ambassadors List will be online by December. To know more about your local Boom Ambassador, please visit the following link HERE.


BACK TO TOP!

 

 

THE BOOM EXPERIENCE

What are the site opening and closing times?
Gates will open at 9am on 11th of August 2016. The festival ends at 6am on 18th of August 2016.

Can I bring a campervan?
Yes, but there are no specific facilities for campervans, like powered sites. Please pour your toilet liquid/waste waters in the special containers provided and NEVER in the compost toilets!!! The chemicals would interrupt the composting process posing a serious threat to everybody's health.

Can I bring my own generator?
No, be respectful of your neighbours and save your carbon footprint.

Can I hire an accommodation onsite?
There are a very limited number of tipis (big tents - Native American style) available for renting. Click here for details!

Is there a special area for children?
Yes. It is called Kids'n'Seeds and is open during the day. It has a variety of activities for children of all ages. Click here for further info. Note: Considering the high temperatures, loud noise and high levels of dust, we recommend parents not to bring children under 2 years of age.

Is there a special needs camp?
Yes, there is. More info about this special area here! You must register to have your space allocated: specialneeds@boomfestival.org

What do I need to bring?
This is a camping event. We recommend that you bring a tent, sleeping bag, mattress, poles, tarps and other infrastructures you might need to create a shaded campsite. Prepare for hot weather. Free water is available on site. There will be plenty of yummy food available for purchase in the restaurant area and in the Boom grocery store. 
Download here the PDF with The Art of Living at Boom (our comprehensive navigation guide for all Boomers) for detailed info.

Can I bring pets?
NO. Pets are not allowed into Boom for their own safety!! The sound levels, heat and responsibility of looking after pets in such an environment lead to the conclusion that it is better to leave them at home! Moreover the Boomland is a high infectious risk area for leshmaniasis that can kill animals!!! Note: if you stay at Caravan Park B, located outside the Boomland, you are allowed to keep your dog there.
Download the PDF with The Art of Living at Boom (our comprehensive navigation guide for all Boomers) for detailed info.
 


How can I take care of myself?
- Drink plenty of water;
- Don’t fall asleep in the sun. You could burn your skin and become dangerously dehydrated (wake up anyone that you see sleeping under the sun!!);
- Keep skin clean by wiping the dust and use sun screen (especially for those with a skin condition);
- Sleep! You may not want to miss a thing, however the experienced festival-goer will tell you that you’ll enjoy the festival even more if you get some sleep;
- Don't party hard too early: The Boom is a weeklong experience, you have plenty of time to have fun and celebrate. Don't peak too early, enjoy the middle way, never loose control and surpass your limits. Behave consciously and responsably!!

Are there restaurants at Boom?
Sure! There are several yummi restaurants both at the Central Plaza and at the Sacred Fire! You can also find some bars and chaishops around the festival! Conscious food places are predominant at Boom Festival. It is mandatory for restaurants to have affordable prices. Boom Festival's food stalls list will be available online around May 2016.

Is there a grocery-store or supermarket?
Yes!! Since 2010 there is a very nice, well equipped supermarket-style shop, with fresh fruits and vegetables, fresh bread, other kinds of food, camping gear, organic toileteries and everything you may need to make your experience at Boom more comfortable.

Can I keep my valuables safe?
Yes. Never leave your valuables in your tent. If you have valuables (credit cards, documents, electronic equipment, etc.) please keep them in the Safe Lockers available at the Info Points closer to you.

Can I make a fire?
A-B-S-O-L-U-T-L-Y  N-O-T  !!!!!!!! The Boomland is an EXTREMELY HIGH Fire risk area. Please don't put yourself, the other Boomers and nature at risk!!! Download the PDF The Art of Living at Boom (our comprehensive navigation guide for all Boomers) for detailed info.

Can I cook at Boom?
You can cook ONLY at the community kitchens in the camping area.
 


Is there an extra cost for camping and caravan park?
No, camping and caravan parking is included in the price of the ticket.

Should i bring a bicycle?
You can use a bicycle inside Boomland. You should bring a bicycle, it is a great way to enjoy the Boomland!

Is there a hospital inside the Boom?
Yes, there is a 24h medical service and ambulance.

Can i bring a sound system?
No.

What is Kosmicare?
Launched in 2002, Kosmicare is an area born from a collaboration among several entities: Boom Festival, Universidade Católica do Porto, MAPS, Check In and the Portuguese governmental institution SICAD (ex-IDT).

The Kosmicare comprises:
- Advice on damage prevention;
- Risk minimisation and Harm reduction: information and support, healthcare, testing;
- A team of multi-lingual volunteers (including psychologists, psychiatrists, and doctors) ready to provide support in case of negative experiences.

Substances are not legal in Portugal, but due to Portuguese decriminalisation laws, projects for risk minimisation and harm reduction (such as Kosmicare) are allowed. Take care of yourself, never use unknown substances.
 


Is there free drinking water?
Yes. Look for the dozens of water taps around the Boomland. The water comes from the public grid and it is regularly analysed by health and safety inspections. Please bring a stainless steel water refiller!

Can I swim in the lake?
Yes. But do not use chemicals (soaps, lotions, etc) on your body that might pollute the lake and do not shit or piss in the water!!! Thank you!!!

Is the water from the lake clean?
The water from the lake is tested several times, it is not suitable for drinking but good to swim in!

Do I get diarrhea at Boom?
The hot climate and the presence of people from all over the world can make the perfect environment for these organisms to thrive! To minimise the risk of bacteria please wash your hands regularly with soap, especially after using the toilets and before eating (use water taps provided with soap near all toilets), and don't piss and shit outside the toilets! A conscious Boom is a safe Boom!

Can I bring glass bottles with me?
No. Glass creates a high risk of injury, maximizes the risk of fire and increases rubbish around the site. Vehicles will be searched for glass. Please pour your drinks into plastic containers.

Can I buy ice at Boom?
There is no ice available at the festival site. However, you will be able to get fresh food products in our grocery store and different kind of delicious food and cold drinks in restaurants and bars spread throughout Boom, all at affordable prices.
 

BACK TO TOP!

 

PROGRAM

When does the music and program start at Boom 2016?
The program starts on the night of the 11th of August 2016 both at the Liminal Village and at the Chill Out Gardens. The Dance Temple, Sacred Fire, Healing Area and Alchemy Circle program starts on the 12th of August.

When does the music end at Boom 2016?
The Alchemy Circle ends at 9pm of the 17th of August. The Dance Temple ends at 00.30am of the 18th of August. The Sacred Fire ends at 3am of the 18th of August. The Chill Out Gardens ends at 6am of the 18th of August 2016.

How many stages and activities does Boom Festival have?
For all info please check Program menu at www.boomfestival.org.
 

BACK TO TOP!

boomguide/caravans-and-cars/.title: Caravans & Cars
boomguide/caravans-and-cars/.body:
Caravans at Boom are given very special attention for Boom loves travellers as much as travellers love Boom!!!

The Boom Team is committed to ensure that Boom is a caravan-friendly festival, with spacious, and equipped parking areas as near as possible to the main areas of Boom. But there are several conditions that need to be considered when big vehicles are in nature.  Please read the instructions for caravans at Boom 2016 carefully.

May Boom ALWAYS be one of the favorite homes of the global nomadic community!!!

 

ORGANISATION OF CARS AND CARAVANS: PARKING AT BOOM 2016


This information has been devised only to improve your Boom experience – so please read the following instructions very carefully.
 

POSITIVE INSTRUCTIONS FOR ALL BOOMERS

1. Please make sure you recycle all of your rubbish at designated recycling points and get rid of your trash in the rubbish bins. DON'T PUT ANYTHING BUT HUMAN WASTE INSIDE THE COMPOST TOILETS! No wet wipes, baby diapers (“nappies”), female hygiene products, cigarettes and the like.
2. Please pour all wastewater/grey water into the appropriate containers provided – if you don’t, you will endanger the environment and its species as well as the well-being of those around you.
3. Never pour the wastewater in the compost toilets! That will kill all the microorganisms and disrupt the composting processes.
4. Help us to keep the Caravan and Camping Areas clean, safe and fun by maintaining your area and looking out for each other's possessions and making friends with your neighbors: WE ARE ONE!
5. Trailer vehicles or small vans are allowed in Caravan Park B. Please be aware of tents around you to prevent accidents.
6. Pets are NOT allowed at Boom. You can choose to stay in Caravan Park B, outside the Boomland and keep your dog there on a leash to prevent dog fights.
7. Please respect the trees, plants and the tiniest form of life you find on the land (there are lots of ants! Do not put your tent on their house!). We can all have fun and still respect nature. 
8. Caravans that enter the Boomland (Caravan Park A) can’t move during the festival.


GUIDELINES FOR CARAVAN PARK A

1. Caravans are not permitted to leave the Caravan Park A area before the 18th of August. We must allow people without vehicles to exit the festival first! – SAFETY COMES FIRST.
2. No dogs allowed.
3. No soundsystems allowed.
4. Shade structures must be smaller than 10 squared mt.
5. Any caravans parked outside the designated areas will be removed and turned into a recycled art installation!
6. WasteWater: ALL WASTE WATER MUST BE COLLECTED IN THE CONTAINERS PROVIDED! PLEASE do not put waste-water into the ground or into a stream because of the danger to the environment and general well-being of everyone around.
7. The caravan parking space is a community environment. Meet your neighbours, look after each other, be mindful of each other's possessions. Make sure you lock your things away, and do not leave your caravan unlocked and unattended.  
8. This is a limited space: please be conscious that many other people will use it too, don't occupy more space than the one you actually need!
9. Motorcycles are not allowed inside caravan park A or inside the festival grounds.
10. Beware with fire! It is Strictly Forbidden to make Fire!

 

GUIDELINES FOR CARAVAN PARK B

1. You can move your caravan during the festival.
2. You are allowed to have your dog if you have the conditions for it in your caravan. The dog must stay in the caravan: this will prevent dog fights and attacks to other fellow Boomers.
3. You can have your own camp but be mindful of the limited space around.
4. Any caravans not parked in designated areas will be removed and turned into recycled art installations.
5. Waste Water: ALL WASTE WATER MUST BE COLLECTED IN THE CONTAINERS PROVIDED! It is illegal to pour waste-water onto the ground or into a stream because of the danger to the environment and to the general well-being of everyone around.
6. The caravan parking space is a family-like environment. Meet your neighbours, look after each other, be mindful of each other's possessions. Make sure you lock your things away, and do not leave your caravan unlocked, unattended.  
7. Be aware if you have tents around you. Test your brakes, never put your caravan on a slope with tents below so as to prevent accidents.


GUIDELINES FOR CAR PARK

1. Respect the Boom Volunteers and their guidance!
2. Do not put your tent in the car park! There is a camping area inside the festival, a few minutes walk from the entrance gate.
3. No dogs allowed.
4. No parking in roads and forbidden areas: your car will be immediately removed if you do so.
5. Please lock your car and watch out for your possessions and your neighbours' possessions.
6. You can move your car during the festival.

 

BE HAPPY AND HAVE LOTS OF FUN!

boomguide/wanbli-tipi-camp/.title: Wanbli Tipi Camp
boomguide/wanbli-tipi-camp/.body:
Welcome to all tribal people to our special Wanbli Tipi Camp, the Eagle Camp, at Boom Festival 2016! Allow your tribal side to re-emerge while staying in a traditional Native American Tipi, as the indigenous (or our ancestors) did on the Great Plains for hundred of years.

These beautiful nomadic homes remind us of the connection between Mother Earth and Father Sky.

Get inspired and enjoy the perfect dwelling harmony in this ancestral circle. Our camp is very well located at a natural spot in the festival surrounded by ancient trees with beautifull views to the lake, a special quiet place to relax and chill for couples, families, friends and all those who wish to have a relaxed and unique experience at Boom.

The Wanbli Tipi Camp offers you traditional accommodation at Tipis and Star Tents, made of heavy duty rain proof canvas and have insulated floors. All of these structures come equipped with air mattresses, bed sheets, pillows, sleeping bags, organic soap, a simple lock and camping light. Just bring your personal belongings, your spirit of adventure and your love for nature.

Our Wanbli Tipi Camp will be located in a calm, shaded and reserved area, close to toilets and showers, so you, your friends and family can get a proper rest from party time. We'll have a 24 hours reception and maintenance service, chill out area and a chaishop serving breakfast and other yummy treats inside the camp.

Specifications of Available Tipis and Start Tents:



Reservations will be available from 11th November.

Explore the magic of authentic sleep in the ” Wanbli Tipi Camp”.


More information, please contact tipicamp@boomfestival.org

 

...

boomguide/special-needs/.title: Special Needs
boomguide/special-needs/.body:
Boom is an inclusive festival. In 2016 we want to offer better conditions to those with special needs.

Boom is an inclusive event that every edition tries to give people with physical disabilities – with or without helpers – the opportunity to participate at Boom with the same conditions as any other Boomer. Every year we try to improve and give our love to every Boomer, especially those with special needs.

These are the services we can provide:

- Special camping area, right next to showers and toilets.

- Some private disabled adapted toilets next to some main areas (keys at the main bars).

- Private parking for disabled only to facilitate access to the festival.

- There will be one person available 24h to take care of all issues related to special needs.

- There is an inclusive shuttle to take people around the festival if needed.

Should you want to use the aforementioned support? All people with special needs seeking disabled access or info should contact us through: specialneeds@boomfestival.org.

boomguide/baby-boom/.title: Baby Boom
boomguide/baby-boom/.body:
The Baby Boom is a quiet and beautiful area of Boom dedicated to the youngest and their parents. This playground is an ideal resting place for children from 3 to 12 years old.

The Baby Boom is offering workshops on: use of natural materials, massage and reiki, yoga mornings, make-your-own-toys, alternative education, conscious food and many others.

Moreover, there will be cinema evenings – two movies per night, one recommended for children up to six years old, focusing on human consciousness and ecological conservation, and the another one for the parents to stimulate brainstorming about alternative ways of learning. Because we believe in free education and in the importance of looking to each child as an individual human being.

We would like to invite all the children and parents to co-create this area – have fun, be together and allow the kids to express their creativity!

Please Note: All the children in the area must be accompanied by their parents or guardians. The Baby Boom area is not a place to leave your kids without supervision.

Children under 13 years have free admission to the Boom. We recommend parents not to bring children under 3 years of age!

If you are coming to the Boom and you would like to contribute to Baby Boom during the event with your knowledge, skills and passion please contact us at: kids@boomfestival.org.

boomguide/pets/.title: Pets
boomguide/pets/.body:
Be mindful: If you love your pet don’t bring it to Boom Festival. PETS ARE NOT ALLOWED AT BOOM!

Having a pet has many benefits, both mental and physical. Besides stress relief, pets provide entertainment, companionship, and comfort. Pets provide a distraction from one’s own problems and can relieve depression, anxiety and even physical pain.

With pet ownership come responsibilities. One of them is not to expose a pet to environments where they can get high levels of stress. For instance, highly potent sound systems like the ones at Boom can produce noise anxiety in pets.

In the region of Portugal where Boom is held temperatures can rise up to 40ºC, which could cause extreme dehydration to your pet.

Additionaly, in this region of the Iberian Peninsula, there are high rates of leishmaniasis, an illness that causes extreme pain and is deadly to pets. The subspecies of the parasite leishmania donovani can infect dogs, causing a disease form called visceral leishmaniasis. Dogs serve as a reservoir of infection. The disease is transmitted between dogs and to people by sandflies.

Another issue is the fact that in past editions there has been many cases of dogs abandoned and incidents were fellow Boomers were attacked by pets that were left alone and in stress. Do you really think it is clever to bring your dog to Boom?

Bringing your pet to Boom can be painful for your animal and can cause risks to public health. Think twice. If you are caught with your pet you will be put out of the festival.

If you stay in Caravan Park B you can keep your dog there, always on a leash (to prevent dog fights or attacks).

In case you need any nice hotel for your pet, here you can find some places:
